author.name: 天智天皇
author.profile: 「てんち」とも。(626-671)中大兄皇子。中臣鎌足と蘇我氏を滅ぼし、大化の改新を行った。近江に遷都し、即位後、近江令を制定した。

interpretation.name: Tenji Tenno
interpretation.profile: (Also known as “Tenchi,” 626-671 C.E.)Formerly known as Nakano-Oe-no-Oji. Overthrowing Nakatomi-no-Kamatari and the Soga clan, he implemented significant reforms. Relocating the capital to Omi as Emperor Tenji, he instituted the Omi decrees.

info.theme: 農夫の辛苦を思いやる天皇の心
info.meaning: 刈り取られた稲の見張り小屋で、ただひとりで夜を明かしていると、葺いてある屋根の苫の編み目が粗いので、私の着物はぐっしょりと夜露で濡れ続けていることよ。
info.interpretation: Waiting for morning in the lookout shed, I watch over the harvest alone. The gaps in the weave of the roof are large, and my kimono, wet from the night mist, never seems to dry.

author.name: 持統天皇
author.profile: (645-702)天智天皇の皇女で、天武天皇の皇后。飛鳥浄御原令を施行、藤原京へ遷都した。

interpretation.name: Jito Tenno
interpretation.profile: (645-702 C.E.)Princess in the court of Emperor Tenji, she was also empress to Emperor Tenmu. She implemented the Asukakiyomihararyo legal code, by which the court was relocated to Fujiwara-kyo.

info.theme: さわやかな夏のおとずれ、時の推移
info.meaning: いつの間にか春が過ぎて夏が来たらしい。どうりで、夏になると白い衣を干すと言い伝えのある天の香具山の麓に、目にも鮮やかな真っ白な衣が干してあるのが見えるよ。
info.interpretation: It seems that spring has already given way to summer. It is said that in the summertime the white robes can be seen hanging out to dry at the foot of Mt. Amanokaguyama. At the moment I see white robes so bright that they stun the eyes.

author.name: 柿本人麻呂
author.yomi: かきのもとのひとまろ
author.profile: (生没年不詳)三十六歌仙の一人。官位は低く任地の島根県で没したという。後世、歌聖と呼ばれた。

interpretation.name: Kakinomoto-no-Hitomaro
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Named one of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets. His official rank was low, and he died at the place where he was posted, in current Shimane Prefecture. He was posthumously regarded as a perfect master of poetry.

info.theme: 長い夜をひとり寝るさびしさの嘆き
info.meaning: 垂れ下がった山鳥の尾羽のような長い長いこの秋の夜を、離ればなれで寝るという山鳥の夫婦のように、私もたった一人で寂しく寝ることになるのかなあ。
info.interpretation: The autumn night is as long as the tail and wings of the peacock. Like the pheasant pairs who sleep apart, I spend this night in lonely solitude.

author.name: 山部赤人
author.profile: (生没年不詳)聖武天皇に仕えた宮廷歌人。自然の美しさを詠んだ叙景歌が特に優れる。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Yamabe-no-Akahito
interpretation.profile: (Birth and death dates unknown)He served as a poet to the court of Emperor Shomu. He was particularly noted for his poems expressing the beauty of natural scenery. He is included amongst the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 富士山の神聖な美しさへの感動
info.meaning: 田子の浦の海岸に出て、はるか向こうを仰いで見ると、神々しいばかりの真っ白な富士山の頂に、今もしきりに雪は降り続いているよ。
info.interpretation: Approaching the shores of the Tago-no-ura, I look to the horizon to catch a glimpse of Mt. Fuji, swathed in mystical white. Snow keeps falling at its glorious summit.

author.name: 猿丸大夫
author.profile: (生没年不詳)『古今集』真名序に名が記されている歌人。各地に伝承が残るが経歴は不明。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Sarumaru Dayu
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)His name is mentioned in the preface of the classical Chinese version of the Kokinshu waka collection. Though a number of oral traditions related to him exist in many different areas, the background to these is shrouded in mystery. He was one of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 暮れてゆく秋山の寂寥と哀感
info.meaning: 遠く人里離れた奥山で、一面散り積もった紅葉の枯れ葉を踏み分けながら、恋の相手を求めて鳴く雄鹿の声を聞くときこそ、秋の悲しさはひとしお身にしみて感じられるものだ。
info.interpretation: In the depths of the faraway mountains, I step on beds of fallen leaves. I hear a deer calling for his mate, and a feeling of sadness pierces my heart.

author.name: 中納言家持
author.yomi: ちゅうなごんやかもち
author.profile: 大伴家持 (718?-785)父は旅人。『万葉集』の編纂に関わったという説も。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Chunagon Yakamochi
interpretation.profile: Otomo-no-Yakamochi (c. 718-785 C.E.)Sun of Tabito. Some believe that he was involved in the compilation of the Manyoshu, and he is included amongst the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 宮中の冬の霜の夜更けの幻想的な美しさ
info.meaning: かささぎが翼を並べて架けたといわれる天の川の橋。それにたとえられる宮中の橋に真っ白な霜が降りて、その白の深さを見るにつけても、夜もいっそう更けてきたことよ。
info.interpretation: The bridge of the Milky Way is said to be formed of the wings of the magpie. The bridge of the imperial court, a match for its beauty, is shrouded in frost, and the shocking white makes the night seem darker still.

author.name: 安倍仲麿
author.profile: (701-770?)留学生として唐に渡り、李白らと交流した。船の難破により帰国に失敗し、唐で没した。

interpretation.name: Abe-no-Nakamaro
interpretation.profile: (701- c. 770 C.E.)Nakamaro traveled to Tang Dynasty China to study, where he and Li Po, and other poets were known to have exchanged views. Due to a shipwreck he was unable to return to Japan, and died in China.

info.theme: 異国で見る月によって催された望郷の念
info.meaning: 大空を仰いで見ると、こうこうと月が照り輝いている。かつて奈良の春日にある三笠山の上に昇っていたあの月が、今ここに同じように出ているのだなあ。
info.interpretation: Looking up at the sky I see the moon shining brightly in all its glory. It strikes a nostalgic chord in me as I remember that moon over Mt. Mikasa at Kasuga of Nara.

author.name: 喜撰法師
author.profile: (生没年不詳)六歌仙の一人だが、伝不詳。宇治山に住んだといわれる。

interpretation.name: Kisen Hoshi
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Though he is one of the Six Immortal Poets, there are no definitive records on his life. He is said to have lived on Mt. Uji.

info.theme: 心静かに住む、宇治での隠棲
info.meaning: 私の庵は都の東南にあり、辺りには鹿もいるほど寂しいが、これこの通り静かに暮らしている。それなのに人は私を世の中をつらいと思って宇治に遁れていると言っているそうだ。
info.interpretation: My little hermitage lies to the southeast of the capital, and it’s such a lonely place that I’m visited by deer, and the quietude is just the way I like it. But people seem to think I’ve taken refuge in Uji because I’ve grown tired of the world.

author.name: 小野小町
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 絶世の美女とされる女流歌人。様々な伝説が残る。六歌仙、三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Ono-no-Komachi
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)She was an extremely well-known for her great beauty as well as her poetry, and her story gave rise to many legends. She is included amongst both the Six Immortal Poets and the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 色あせた桜に寄せての、容色の衰えと憂愁の心
info.meaning: 桜の花の色がすっかり色あせてしまったと同じように、私の容姿もすっかり衰えてしまったなあ。桜に降る長雨を眺め、むなしく恋の思いにふけっている間に。
info.interpretation: I feel I’ve faded, just like the cherry blossoms that have lost their color. Watching the endless rain, I get lost in the sadness of my thoughts of past loves lost.

author.name: 蟬丸
author.profile: (生没年不詳 十世紀ごろか) 宇多天皇の皇子に仕えた雑色、または醍醐天皇の皇子という説がある。

interpretation.name: Semimaru
interpretation.profile: His birth and death dates are unknown, but it is assumed that he lived around the tenth century. Some believe that he may have served the son of Emperor Uda, or that he himself was the son of Emperor Daigo.

info.theme: 人々が出逢っては別れる、逢坂の関に寄せる感慨
info.meaning: これが都（京都）から東へ下っていく人も、都へ帰ってくる人も、顔見知りの人もそうでない人も逢っては別れ、別れては逢うというこの名の通りの逢坂の関なのだなあ。
info.interpretation: This place is rightfully called “the meeting place.” People traveling from Kyoto to the east, people coming home to Kyoto, people who know each others’ faces, and people who don’t?they all meet and say goodbye, and say goodbye and meet again.

author.name: 参議篁
author.profile: 小野篁 (802-852) 参議岑守の子。博学で、漢詩や和歌に優れる。現世と冥界を行き来したなど伝説が残る。

interpretation.name: Sangi Takamura
interpretation.profile: Ono-no-Takamura (802-852 C.E.)Son of Sangi Minemori. He was known as an excellent scholar of Chinese poetry and waka. Legend has it that he would pass between the temporal world and the afterworld.

info.theme: 配流の舟出の孤独感と、都の人に寄せる思慕の情
info.meaning: 海原はるかに多くの島々を目指して私を乗せた舟は漕ぎ出していったと、都（京都）にいる私の親しい人に告げておくれ。そこにいる漁師の釣り舟よ。
info.interpretation: Oh, fisherman in the boat over there! Tell my love in Kyoto that my boat has left, headed for the islands out on the vast ocean.

author.name: 僧正遍昭
author.yomi: そうじょうへんじょう
author.profile: (816-890) 桓武天皇の皇孫。仁明天皇に仕え、天皇崩御を機に出家した。六歌仙、三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Sojo Henjo
interpretation.profile: (816-890 C.E.)He was a grandchild of Emperor Kanmu. He served Emperor Ninmyo, and became a monk upon the emperor’s death. He was named both one of the Six Immortal Poets and the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 五節の舞姫の美しさに魅せられ、これを賛美する心
info.meaning: 大空を吹く風よ、雲の中の通路を閉じておくれ。天に戻っていきそうな、この美しい天女たちをとどめて、今しばらくその舞を見ていたいと思うから。
info.interpretation: Winds high in the sky, close the pathway through the clouds! These angels who have descended to the earth are about to take leave, but I want to see them dance a bit more.

author.name: 陽成院
author.profile: (868-949) 清和天皇の皇子。幼くして即位したが精神を患って退位。晩年は和歌に没頭した。

interpretation.name: Yozei-in
interpretation.profile: (868-949 C.E.)A prince of the court of Emperor Seiwa, he is said to have suffered from mental instability after acceding to his position at a tender young age. He concentrated his energies on waka during his later years.

info.theme: ひそかな恋心が積もり深い物思いに悩んでいること
info.meaning: 筑波山の峰から流れ落ちる男女川は、流れ行くとともに水量が増して淵（深み）となるように、私の恋心も、時とともに思いは深まり、今は淵のように深い恋になってしまった。
info.interpretation: Like the Minano River that grows deeper as it flows from the peaks of Mt. Tsukuba, my feelings deepen with time, and now I am hopelessly in love.

author.name: 河原左大臣
author.profile: 源融 (822-895) 嵯峨天皇の皇子。賀茂川西岸に広大な邸宅・河原院を造営。光源氏のモデルとも。

interpretation.name: Kawara-no-Sadaijin
interpretation.profile: Minamoto-no-Toru (822-895 C.E.)Son of Emperor Saga, he is known to have built a massive estate, the Kawara-no-in, on the west bank of the Kamo River. Some believe that the character of Hikaru Genji is based on his life.

info.theme: 相手のために乱れてしまった心の強い高ぶり
info.meaning: 陸奥のしのぶもじずりの乱れ模様のように、私の心は忍ぶ恋のために乱れています。このように乱れはじめたのは誰のせいでしょうか。私ではなくて皆あなたのせいなのですよ。
info.interpretation: Like the wild-looking dye patterns of Mutsu, my heart is in complete chaos. Is this chaos my fault? No, this is entirely your fault.

author.name: 光孝天皇
author.profile: (830-887) 仁明天皇の皇子。陽成天皇廃位の後、五十五歳で即位した。温厚な性格で学問を好んだ。

interpretation.name: Koko Tenno
interpretation.profile: (830-887 C.E.)Son of Emperor Ninmyo. After the overthrow of Emperor Yozei, he acceded to the throne at the age of 55. He was known for his warmth of character and love of academic learning.

info.theme: 雪に降られながら若菜を摘む、相手へのまごころ
info.meaning: あなたに差し上げるために、春の野原に出て若菜を摘んでいる。その私の着物の袖に雪がしきりに降りかかっている。
info.interpretation: I have come to the spring meadows to pick herbs for you. The spring snow falls endlessly on my kimono sleeve.

author.name: 中納言行平
author.yomi: ちゅうなごんゆきひら
author.profile: 在原行平 (818-893) 平城天皇の皇孫。漢詩に優れ、在原氏一門の子弟の教育のために奨学院を創設した。

interpretation.name: Chunagon Yukihira
interpretation.profile: Ariwara-no-Yukihira (818-893 C.E.)He was also a grandchild of Emperor Heizei. Excelling in Chinese poetry, he built the academy of Shogakuin for the education of the Ariwara family.

info.theme: 別れに際して名残を惜しむ人への挨拶
info.meaning: あなたとお別れして、因幡の国へ行きますが、その地にあるいなばの山の峰に生える松のようにあなたが待っていると聞いたなら、今すぐにでも帰って来ましょう。
info.interpretation: I take leave of you now to travel to Inaba, but if you tell me that you’ll wait for me like the pine trees that grow there, I’ll be sure to come back soon.

author.name: 在原業平朝臣
author.yomi: ありわらのなりひらあそん
author.profile: (825-880) 平城天皇の皇孫で、行平の弟。美男で、『伊勢物語』の主人公とも。六歌仙、三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Ariwara-no-Narihira-ason
interpretation.profile: (825-880 C.E.)He was a grandchild of Emperor Heizei and the younger brother of Yukihira. Regarded as an extremely handsome man, it is said that he may have been the model for the protagonist in the Ise Monogatari (Tales of Ise). He was one of the Six Immortal Poets and of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 竜田川に散り流れる紅葉の華麗な美しさ
info.meaning: 遠い昔、数々の不思議なことが起こっていたという神代でさえも聞いたことがありません。川面一面に紅葉が散り浮いて流れ、この竜田川の水を真紅色の絞り染めにするとは。
info.interpretation: To make a ruby red dye from the fallen leaves that cover the Tatsuta River: this is something unheard of even in the time of the mythical gods, when mysterious occurrences happened all the time.

author.name: 藤原敏行朝臣
author.yomi: ふじわらのとしゆきあそん
author.profile: (?-901?) 在原業平の妻の妹と結婚。三十六歌仙の一人で、能書家。

interpretation.name: Fujiwara-no-Toshiyuki-ason
interpretation.profile: (?-c. 901 C.E.)Married the sister of the wife of Ariwara-no-Narihira. He is included amongst the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets and was also a calligraphy master.

info.theme: 夢においても人目を忍ぶ恋のもどかしさ
info.meaning: 住吉の海岸に打ち寄せる波の、そのよるという言葉ではありませんが、昼はもちろん、夜までもどうして私は夢の中の恋の通い道で人目を避けるのでしょう。
info.interpretation: A bit like the waves that pound the shores of Sumiyoshi, my mind is pervaded by thoughts of love alone throughout the day, and even the night?why is it so? I am now so absorbed that I avoid others.

author.name: 伊勢
author.profile: (875?-940?) 宇多天皇中宮温子に仕えた。伊勢の通称は父の任国から。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Ise
interpretation.profile: (c. 875-940 C.E.)Served Onshi, empress to Emperor Uda. Her popular name “Ise” comes from the region to which her father was assigned as a government officer. She was one of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 訪れて来ない男をなじる恨みと嘆きの心
info.meaning: 難波潟に生い育つあの葦の節と節の短い間のように、そんな短い間でさえ、あなたとお逢いしないで、このままこの世を過ごせとおっしゃるのですか。とてもできません。
info.interpretation: I cannot stand even the thought of not seeing you, even for the shortest length of time?even for a time as short as the joints on the reeds that grown in Naniwa Bay.

author.name: 元良親王
author.profile: (890-943) 陽成天皇の第一皇子。色好みの貴公子で、『大和物語』などに女性との贈答歌が多く残る。

interpretation.name: Motoyoshi Shinno
interpretation.profile: (890-943 C.E.)The first son of Emperor Yozei, he was known as a ladies’ man, and many conversations in the form of poems appear in Yamato Monogatari (Tales of Yamato) and other works.

info.theme: 身を滅ぼしてでも会いたいという激しい恋心
info.meaning: うわさが立ち、逢うこともままならない今は、もはや身を捨てたのも同じこと。それならばいっそ難波潟の「みをつくし」ではありませんが、この身を捨ててもあなたにお逢いしたい。
info.interpretation: The rumors keep us from meeting, and to me this is like giving up my own life. Like the solitary channel markers of Naniwa Bay, I would gladly give up, this life to see you.

author.name: 素性法師
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 僧正遍昭の子。清和天皇に仕えた後、父の命で若くして出家。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Sosei Hoshi
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Child of Sojo Henjo. After serving Emperor Seiwa, he became a monk at the behest of his father. He was one of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 約束しながら来なかった男への恨み言
info.meaning: 「今すぐ行くよ」とあなたがおっしゃるので、秋の夜長を今か今かと待つうちに、まあなんてこと、とうとう九月の明け方の月が出るまで、待つことになってしまったことですよ。
info.interpretation: You say that you want to see me now, but I must wait in anticipation for the long autumn nights, for alas we cannot meet until the moon of the first light of September rises.

author.name: 文屋康秀
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 平安初期の歌人で、六歌仙の一人だが、官位は低かった。

interpretation.name: Funya-no-Yasuhide
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)A poet of the early Heian Period, he was named one of the Six Immortal Poets despite his low official rank.

info.theme: 秋の草木をしおれさせる山風の荒々しさ
info.meaning: 山風が荒々しく吹きおろすと、たちまち秋の草木がしおれてしまう。なるほど荒々しいからそれで「あらし」、また山から吹く風なので文字通り「嵐」というのだろうか。
info.interpretation: The autumn vegetation starts to wither when the fierce mountain winds blow violently down the mountain, and the spectacle is no less than a tempest.

author.name: 大江千里
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 父は漢学者の音人とされる。学識豊かだが官位は低かった。中古三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Oe-no-Chisato
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)His father, Otondo, was known as a great scholar of Chinese studies. Though his official rank was low, he was known for his academic achievement. He is included amongst the Thirty-Six Medieval Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 秋の夜の月をながめて、物思いにふける孤独の悲哀
info.meaning: 秋の月を見ていると様々なことが悲しく感じられます。私一人を悲しませるために秋が来るというのではないのですが。
info.interpretation: I’m overcome with sadness at the sight of the fall moon. It seems that the autumn comes just to make me melancholy.

author.name: 菅家
author.profile: 菅原道真 (845-903) 天皇に重用され右大臣に至るが、政略により太宰府へ左遷された。

interpretation.name: Kanke
interpretation.profile: Sugawara-no-Michizane (845-903 C.E.)He eventually acceded to the position of Udaijin to the emperor, but was demoted to Dazaifu as part of a political strategy.

info.theme: 手向山の紅葉を幣としてささげること
info.meaning: このたびの旅は急なお出掛けのため、お供えの幣帛の用意もできていません。とりあえず、この手向山の美しい紅葉の錦を幣帛として神よ、御心のままにお受け取りください。
info.interpretation: Because I left in a hurry on this journey, I failed to even bring something to offer at the shrine. Please accept the dazzling blanket of changing leaves over Mt. Tamukeyama as an offering from my heart.

author.name: 三条右大臣
author.yomi: さんじょうのうだいじん
author.profile: 藤原定方 (873-932) 内大臣高藤の子で、中納言朝忠の父。三条に邸宅を構えたので三条右大臣と呼ばれた。

interpretation.name: Sanjo-no-Udaijin
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Sadakata (873-932 C.E.)A child of Naidaijin Takafuji, he was also father to Chunagon Asatada. He was also called Sanjo Udaijin for his residence in Sanjo.

info.theme: 誰にも知られないで逢いたいという切実な思慕の情
info.meaning: 逢坂山のさねかずらが、あなたに逢って寝るという意味を暗示しているなら、そのさねかずらの蔓をくるくる手繰るように他人に知られず、あなたのもとへ来る方法がないものか。
info.interpretation: If this kadsura vine from Mt. Osaka carries the secret message that we are to meet and spend the night together, I will turn it over in my hands in full view of others without them knowing, wondering how I can get to you. If only it were as easy as tugging on this vine.

author.name: 貞信公
author.profile: 藤原忠平 (880-949) 基経の子。兄時平の死により氏長者となって政権を握る。藤原氏全盛の礎を築いた。

interpretation.name: Teishinko
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Tadahira (880-949 C.E.)Child of Mototsune. Upon the death of his brother Tokihira, he became representative and leader of the Fujiwara clan, establishing the foundations for the prosperity of the clan.

info.theme: 紅葉の美しさへの賛美と、散らずにいてほしい願望
info.meaning: 小倉山の峰の紅葉よ。ああ、あなたにもし心があるならば、もう一度天皇のお出まし（行幸）があるまで、どうか散らずにそのままで待っていてください。
info.interpretation: Oh, changing leaves of the peaks of Mt. Ogura: only you understand my heart. If you have the chance to welcome the emperor just once more, please keep your leaves until then.

author.name: 中納言兼輔
author.yomi: ちゅうなごんかねすけ
author.profile: 藤原兼輔 (877-933) 藤原冬嗣の曾孫、紫式部の曾祖父。賀茂川の堤に邸宅を造営。紀貫之らと親交が深かった。

interpretation.name: Chunagon Kanesuke
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Kanesuke (877-933 C.E.) Great-grandchild of Fujiwara-no-Fuyutsugu, he was great-grandfather to Murasaki Shikibu. He built a residence along the banks of the Kamo River. He was on very friendly terms with Ki-no-Tsurayuki and his circle of friends.

info.theme: まだ見ぬ女性に対する強い恋心の不思議さ
info.meaning: みかの原を分けるようにわき出て流れるいづみ川ではないけれど、いつ見たためか、いつ逢ったのか、いや本当は逢ったこともないのに、どうしてこんなに恋しいのだろう。
info.interpretation: Like the changing views surrounding the Izumi River that flows through the meadows of Mikanohara, I am not sure when I saw you, when I met you, or even if it was not all a dream, and yet my heart aches to no end.

author.name: 源宗于朝臣
author.yomi: みなもとのむねゆきあそん
author.profile: (?-939) 光孝天皇の皇孫。官位は低く、不遇な逸話が『大和物語』に残る。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Minamoto-no-Muneyuki-ason
interpretation.profile: (?-939 C.E.)He was a descendent of Emperor Koko. His rank was low, and he appears in the Yamato Monogatari (Tales of Yamato) lamenting his difficulties. He is included amongst the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 人も訪れず草も枯れてしまう冬の山里の寂寥感
info.meaning: 山中の里はいつの季節でも寂しいけれど、冬にはその寂しさがいっそう身にしみて感じられることだよ。人の行き来も途絶えてしまい、草も木もすっかり枯れ果ててしまうかと思うと。
info.interpretation: The mountain villages have a lonely air throughout the seasons, but in winter they seem a thousand times more desolate. No one passes through these parts during this time, and the grass and trees all wither away?the very thought leaves me melancholy.

author.name: 凡河内躬恒
author.yomi: おおしこうちのみつね
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 紀貫之らと『古今集』の撰者に任ぜられた。官位は低かった。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Oshikochi-no-Mitsune
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Though of low official rank, he was selected along with Ki-no-Tsurayuki and others for the Kokinshu waka collection. He is included amongst the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 初霜にまぎれるばかりの白菊の清楚な美しさ
info.meaning: 当てずっぽうに折るのなら折ってみようか。初霜が一面に降りたために真っ白になって、どれが花やら霜やら見分けがつかなくなってしまっている白菊の花を。
info.interpretation: The ground is covered in a blanket of pure white with the first frost, and we can’t find the brilliant white chrysanthemums underneath. But let us try and pick them anyway.

author.name: 壬生忠岑
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 官位は低かったが、『古今集』撰者に任ぜられ、歌人として活躍した。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Mibu-no-Tadamine
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Though his official rank was low,he was asked to compile the "Kokinshu"waka collection,and was active as a poet.He is included amongst the"Thirty-Six Immortal Poets."

info.theme: よそよそしい態度を見せた女性への恨み言
info.meaning: 明け方の月が冷ややかに、そっけなく空に残っていたように、あなたが冷たく見えたあの別れ以来、夜明けほどつらく思えるものはありません。
info.interpretation: Ever since the morning we parted, when the dull moon hung wanly in the sky and you seemed so cold, nothing has been harder for me than the dawn.

author.name: 坂上是則
author.yomi: さかのうえのこれのり
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 平安初期に蝦夷を平定した坂上田村麻呂の子孫。和歌に秀で、三十六歌仙の一人。蹴鞠の名手。

interpretation.name: Sakanoue-no-Korenori
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)He is a descendent of Sakanoue-no-Tamuramaro, who subjugated the Ainu in the early Heian Period. An outstanding waka poet, he was named amongst the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets. He was also known as a superior kemari player.

info.theme: 有明の月のように明るく降り積もる吉野の雪の清さ
info.meaning: ほのぼのと夜が明けるころ、明け方の月が照らしているのかと見間違えるほどに、吉野の里に白く降り積もっている雪であることよ。
info.interpretation: When the dawn broke after a lovely night, the snow of Yoshino is so brilliant one that one could mistake it for the moon at dawn.

author.name: 春道列樹
author.profile: (?-920) 身分が低く、詳しい経歴は不明。壱岐守に任命されたが、赴任する前に没したという。

interpretation.name: Harumichi-no-Tsuraki
interpretation.profile: (?-920 C.E.)Not much else is known of his life except for the fact that he was of the lower classes. Though he was appointed Iki-no-kami, he passed away before acceding to the post.

info.theme: 山川にしがらみのように散りたまった紅葉の美しさ
info.meaning: 山あいを流れる川に風が作ったしがらみ（川の流れをせき止める柵）は、よく見ると流れることができないでたまっている紅葉の葉であったのだなあ。
info.interpretation: A dam on the river cutting through mountain ravines created by the wind is, upon a closer look, a pile of fallen autumn leaves that cannot be swept down the stream.

author.name: 紀友則
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 紀貫之の従兄弟。『古今集』撰者となるが、完成を見ずに病で没した。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Ki-no-Tomonori
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Cousin to Ki-no-Tsurayuki. Though he was one of the compilers of the Kokinshu waka collection, he passed away due to illness before the project could be completed. He was amongst the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 春ののどかな陽光の中に散る桜の美しさを惜しむ心
info.meaning: 日の光がこんなにものどかな春の日に、どうして桜の花だけが落ち着いた気持ちもなく、慌ただしく散ってしまうのだろうか。
info.interpretation: On this gentle sunny spring day, I wonder why only the cherry blossoms cannot stay calm, instead scattering every which way on the ground.

author.name: 藤原興風
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 日本最古の歌学書『歌経標式』を記した藤原浜成の曾孫にあたる。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Fujiwara-no-Okikaze
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Great-grandson of Fujiwara-no-Hamanari, author of the Kakyo Hyoshiki, the oldest book of Japanese poetry in existence. He is included amongst the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 昔の友人がみな死んでしまった、孤独な老いの嘆き
info.meaning: 年老いた私は、今もう誰を友にしたらよいのだろうか。相手にできそうなものといえば、長生きで知られている高砂の松ぐらいなものだが、その高砂の松でさえ、昔からの友ではないのに。
info.interpretation: Who can I call my friend at this old age? The only ones who know I’ve lived this long are the pines of Takasago, and even they have not been my friends for long.

author.name: 紀貫之
author.profile: (?-945) 当代一の歌人で、『古今集』の中心的撰者。土佐守に任ぜられて『土佐日記』を著した。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Ki-no-Tsurayuki
interpretation.profile: (?-945 C.E.)Considered the greatest poet of his time, he was one of the chief compilers of the Kokinshu waka collection. Acceding to the position of Tosa-no-kami, he was posted to Tosa, where he penned the Tosa Nikki (Tosa Diary). He is one of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 変わらぬ梅の美しさと、人の心のうつろいやすさ
info.meaning: あなたは、さあ、心変わりしておられるかどうか分かりませんが、昔なじみのこの里では梅の花が昔と変わらずによい香りを漂わせて咲いていることだ。
info.interpretation: You may have changed your mind for all I know, but the plum blossoms of this village are blooming with that same heavenly scent of long ago.

author.name: 清原深養父
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 清原元輔の祖父で、清少納言の曾祖父。琴の名手だったという。中古三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Kiyohara-no-Fukayabu
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)He was the grandfather of Kiyohara-no-Motosuke, and the great-grandfather of Sei Shonagon. Also as a master of the harp, he is included amongst the Thirty-Six Medieval Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 雲の彼方に姿を隠している、夏の夜の月を惜しむ心
info.meaning: 夏の夜はとても短く、まだ宵の口だと思っているうちに、もう夜が明けてしまう。これではいったい雲のどの辺りに月はとどまっていられるのだろうか。
info.interpretation: The summer nights are so short, when you think the night’s only just begun, it’s already dawn. Where in the clouds is the moon hiding?

author.name: 文屋朝康
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 文屋康秀の子。詳しい経歴は不明だが、官位には恵まれなかったようだ。

interpretation.name: Funya-no-Asayasu
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Son of Funya-no-Yasuhide. Though little is known about him, it appears that his official rank remained low.

info.theme: 秋の野の風に散り乱れる白露の美しさ
info.meaning: 葉の上に降りた美しい白露に、しきりと風が吹きすさぶ秋の野。風で散ってゆく白露はまるで一本の糸で貫き止まっていない玉を、この秋の野に散りばめたようだなあ。
info.interpretation: The stunning white dew sits beautifully atop the meadow leaves, blown endlessly by the autumn wind. The blazing white dew droplets look as if they are held ever so tenuously on a string, and they’re scattered across the meadow this fall.

author.name: 右近
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 十世紀中頃、醍醐天皇の中宮穏子に仕えた女房。右近の通称は父の官位から。

interpretation.name: Ukon
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Served Onshi, empress to Emperor Daigo, as a lady-in-waiting. Her popular name is derived from her father’s rank.

info.theme: 愛を誓った相手が神罰で滅びゆくことを惜しむ恋心
info.meaning: あなたに忘れられる私のこの身がどうなろうともかまわない。それよりも神に誓った私との愛を破ったことで神罰が下り、あなたの命が失われることが悔しいのです。
info.interpretation: I really don’t care what becomes of me now that you have forgotten about us. It is I who pity you, because you who will lose your life to divine punishment for breaking the promise that we made before God.

author.name: 参議等
author.profile: 源等 (880-951) 嵯峨天皇の曾孫。丹波や山城など地方官を歴任した。

interpretation.name: Sangi Hitoshi
interpretation.profile: Minamoto-no-Hitoshi (880-951 C.E.)The great-grandchild of Emperor Saga, he served as a local official in areas such as Tanba and Yamashiro.

info.theme: おさえられない恋心の切なさの告白
info.meaning: 浅茅が生えている小野の篠原ではないが、この心を耐え忍んでも、耐えきれぬほどにどうしてこんなにも、あなたのことが恋しくてたまらないのだろうか。
info.interpretation: I wonder why I must endure this heartbreak?why, as if I were a reed in the meadows, I must keep on enduring, why I miss you so very much.

author.name: 平兼盛
author.profile: (?-990) 光孝天皇の玄孫。『袋草紙』には赤染衛門の父とあるが真偽は不明。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Taira-no-Kanemori
interpretation.profile: (?-990 C.E.)He was the great-great-grandson of Emperor Koko. He is portrayed as the father of Akazome Emon in Fukuro Zoshi, but there is a lack of other evidence to support this. He is included amongst the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 隠せば隠すほど表情に表れてしまう悩ましい恋心
info.meaning: 私の恋心は、誰にも知られまいと心に決め、耐え忍んできたが、とうとうこらえきれず顔に出てしまったのか。何か物思いがあるのですかと人が尋ねてくるほどに。
info.interpretation: I promised myself that no one would know of my love for you, but in the end I couldn’t hide it in my face, and people even inquire of me what has happened.

author.name: 壬生忠見
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 忠岑の子。数々の歌合の作者として活躍したが、官位は低かった。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Mibu-no-Tadami
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Son of Tadamine, he actively took part in poetry competitions in a number of poetry circles, though his official rank was low. He was one of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: ひそかな恋が人の噂になってしまったことへの当惑
info.meaning: 私が恋をしてしまったという浮き名が、こんなにも早く世間に広まってしまった。誰にも知られないよう自分の心の中だけで、ひそかにあの人を思いはじめたのに。
info.interpretation: I wanted to let my love for her grow secretly and quietly in my heart, but my feelings are already the talk of the town.

author.name: 清原元輔
author.profile: (908-990) 深養父の孫、清少納言の父。地方官を歴任し、任地の肥後で没した。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Kiyohara-no-Motosuke
interpretation.profile: (908-990 C.E.)Grandchild of Fukayabu and father of Sei Shonagon. After serving as a local government officer in several locations, he died at Higo, one of his postings. He was named one of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 約束を守らずに心変わりした女性の不実をなじる心
info.meaning: 誓い合いましたね。お互いの涙で濡れた袖を絞りながら。心変わりをすれば波が越すという末の松山を波が越すことがないように、私たち二人の愛も決して変わりはしないと。
info.interpretation: We promised each other that we would always be there for each other, as we wrung the sleeves of our kimonos wet with our tears. We swore that Sue-no-Matsuyama would be inundated with waves if we ever broke our promise, and so we for Sue-no-Matsuyama we vow that our love will never change.

author.name: 権中納言敦忠
author.yomi: ごんちゅうなごんあつただ
author.profile: 藤原敦忠 (906-943) 時平の三男。三十八歳で早世し、菅原道真の怨霊の仕業とされた。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Gonchunagon Atsutada
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Atsutada (906-943 C.E.)He was the third son of Tokihira. Having passed away at the age of just 38, he was believed by the people to have been cursed by the vengeful spirit of Sugawara-no-Michizane. He was one of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 契りを結んでからの深い恋心の切なさ
info.meaning: どうかしてあなたに逢いたいと思っていたが、逢ってみるとかえって苦しく、切ない今のこの気持ちに比べると、逢う前の恋の悩みは何ほどのこともなかったのだなあ。
info.interpretation: I pined with all my heart to cast eyes on you, but once I did it was agonizing. The pain I felt longing to meet you pales in comparison to the despair I feel now.

author.name: 中納言朝忠
author.yomi: ちゅうなごんあさただ
author.profile: 藤原朝忠 (910-966) 三条右大臣定方の子。笙の名人で、三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Chunagon Asatada
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Asatada (910-966 C.E.)He was the child of Sanjo-no-Udaijin Sadakata. Known as a master of the flute, he was also amongst the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 逢ってかえってつれなくなった相手を恨む苦しみ
info.meaning: もし逢うことが絶対にないのなら、かえってあの人をも私自身をも恨むことはしないだろうに。
info.interpretation: If there is no chance on earth for us to meet, then there is no use in blaming either one of us.

author.name: 謙徳公
author.profile: 藤原伊尹「これまさ」とも。 (924-972) 貞信公の孫。能書家で三蹟の一人である行成の祖父。

interpretation.name: Kentokuko
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Koretada (924-972 C.E.)Also known as “Koremasa,” he was the grandchild of Teishinko, and the grandfather of Yukinari, one of the three great calligraphy masters of the time.

info.theme: 女に捨てられた男の、孤独な弱い心
info.meaning: 私のことをかわいそうだと悲しんでくれそうな人が思い浮かばなくて、きっと私は一人恋焦がれて、むなしく死んでいくのにちがいないのだろうなあ。
info.interpretation: I know of no one who would pity me in my bleak circumstances. I am afraid that I am fated to die feeling empty, with nothing but unrequited passion.

author.name: 曾禰好忠
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 教養はあるが、招かれぬ円融院の御遊に参上して追い返されるなど、異色の歌人といわれた。

interpretation.name: Sone-no-Yoshitada
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Though educated, he was known for his eccentricity, such as arriving uninvited at a gathering hosted by Enyu-in.

info.theme: 将来の予測のつかない恋の行く末の不安
info.meaning: 由良の海峡を渡って行く舟人が、櫂をなくしてどうすることもできず、行く先もわからないで漂うように、これからの私の恋の行く末もわからないことだ。
info.interpretation: Like a boatman trying to negotiate the water of the Yura strait without his paddles, floating directionless on the seas, I have no way of knowing where my love will take me.

author.name: 恵慶法師
author.profile: 十世紀後半の人物で、生没年不詳。当代一流の歌人らと交流があった。中古三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Egyo Hoshi
interpretation.profile: Though it is known that he lived in the latter half of the 10th century, his birth and death dates are unknown. One of the Thirty-Six Medieval Immortal Poets, he associated with the top poets of his time.

info.theme: 訪れるものは秋だけという荒れた住まいのわびしさ
info.meaning: 幾重にも蔓草が生い茂るこの家は寂しいので、こんな寂しい所に誰も訪ねては来ないけれども、秋だけはいつものようにやってきたのだなあ。
info.interpretation: No one bothers to come to this forlorn-looking house wrapped in vines?until autumn, my long-awaited visitor, arrives at last.

author.name: 源重之
author.profile: (?-1000) 清和天皇の曾孫。相模権守など地方官を歴任し、旅の歌を多く残した。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Minamoto-no-Shigeyuki
interpretation.profile: (?-1000 C.E.)The great-grandchild of Emperor Seiwa, he served as a local government officer in several locations including Sagami, composing many poems during his travels. He was named one of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: つれない女性のために思い悩む片思いのやるせなさ
info.meaning: 風が激しいので、岩にぶちあたって砕け散る波のように、あなたの冷たさに私の心も砕けるくらいに思い悩む今日この頃だなあ。
info.interpretation: Like the waves that are smashed up against the rocky coast by forceful winds, your coldness pierces my heart and I feel nothing but heartache.

author.name: 大中臣能宣
author.yomi: おおなかとみのよしのぶ
author.profile: (921-991) 伊勢神宮祭主。伊勢大輔の祖父。有名な歌人で、円融・花山両天皇から歌集の献上を度々命じられた。三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Onakatomi-no-Yoshinobu
interpretation.profile: (921-991 C.E.)Served as the chief officiate at Ise Shrine. He is the grandfather of Ise-no-Taifu. A very famous poet, he was repeatedly ordered by Emperor Enyu and Emperor Kazan to compile poetry collections. He was one of the Thirty-Six Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 夜も昼も思い悩む恋心の苦しみ
info.meaning: 宮中の門を守る衛士がたくかがり火のように、夜は燃え、昼になると消えるように、私の恋心も夜は熱い思いで身を焦がし、昼は魂が消えそうになるほど思い悩むのだ。
info.interpretation: Like the beacon fires lit by the guards of the imperial court, my heart burns with passion at night, but goes cold with the sunrise. The days are so painful that I feel my soul itself may disappear.

author.name: 藤原義孝
author.profile: (954-974) 謙徳公の子で、藤原行成の父。二十一歳で痘瘡にかかり没す。信心深く、極楽往生したと伝わる。中古三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Fujiwara-no-Yoshitaka
interpretation.profile: (954-974 C.E.)Son of Kentokuko, he was also father to Fujiwara-no-Yukinari. He died of smallpox at the age of 21. He is said to have been a man of great faith and therefore to have died a peaceful death. He was one of the Thirty-Six Medieval Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 命まで惜しくないと思った恋の永続を願う気持ち
info.meaning: あなたのためにはたとえ捨てても惜しくはないと思っていた命だけれど、あなたに逢った今となっては長生きをしたいと思うようになってしまったよ。
info.interpretation: Though I felt I would gladly give up my life for you, after seeing your face I now have reason to want to live long.

author.name: 藤原実方朝臣
author.yomi: ふじわらのさねかたあそん
author.profile: (?-998) 貞信公の曾孫。光源氏のモデルとする説も。陸奥守として任地で没す。中古三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Fujiwara-no-Sanekata-ason
interpretation.profile: (?-998 C.E.)He was the great-grandchild of Teishinko, and some people believe he may be the model for the Hikaru Genji character. He passed away at Mutsu, where he held the position of Mutsu-no-kami. He was one of the Thirty-Six Medieval Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 胸にあまる切ない恋心を相手に訴えようとする心
info.meaning: こんなに恋い慕っているということだけでもあなたに伝えたいのですが、伝えられない。あなたは知らないでしょう。伊吹山のさしも草のように燃え上がる私の思いを。
info.interpretation: I want to tell you only of how much I love you, but I cannot say even that. You have no idea whatsoever of how I feel?you have no clue that my heart burns for you like the grasses of Mt. Ibuki.

author.name: 藤原道信朝臣
author.yomi: ふじわらのみちのぶあそん
author.profile: (972-994) 太政大臣為光の子で、藤原兼家の養子となる。二十三歳で早世。中古三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Fujiwara-no-Michinobu-ason
interpretation.profile: (972-994 C.E.)Born to Daijodaijin Tamemitsu, he was adopted by Fujiwara-no-Kaneie. He passed away at the young age of 23, but was named one of the Thirty-Six Medieval Immortal Poets.

info.theme: また逢えると知りながらも別れて帰る夜明けのつらさ
info.meaning: 夜が明けるとまた日が暮れ、いずれ再びあなたと逢えるとは分かっていても、やはりこの別れを促す夜明けは恨めしいことだ。
info.interpretation: The dawn comes and another day passes, and though I know we will meet again, still the sight of the morning light pains my heart.

author.name: 右大将道綱母
author.yomi: うだいしょうみちつなのはは
author.profile: (937?-995) 藤原兼家の妻で、道綱の母。『蜻蛉日記』に不遇な結婚生活を綴る。中古三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Udaisho Michitsuna-no-haha
interpretation.profile: (c. 937-995 C.E.)Wife of Fujiwara-no-Kaneie and mother of Michitsuna. In the Kagero Nikki (Kagero Diary), she wrote on the theme of unhappy marriage. She is included amongst the Thirty-Six Medieval Immortal Poets.

info.theme: ひとり寝の長くつらい夜の嘆きを相手に訴える心
info.meaning: あなたが来ないのを嘆きながら、一人寝る夜が明けるまでの間がどんなにか長いものであるかをあなたはご存じでしょうか。いいえ、おわかりではないでしょうねえ。
info.interpretation: I wonder if you know how long the night seems as I wait for you alone, wishing you were here. Alas, I do not think you know.

author.name: 儀同三司母
author.profile: (?-996) 高階貴子。藤原道隆の妻で、伊周や定子（一条天皇中宮）らの母。儀同三司（准大臣）は伊周の官位。

interpretation.name: Gidosanshi-no-haha
interpretation.profile: (?-996 C.E.)Otherwise known as Takashina-no-Kishi, she was also the wife of Fujiwara-no-Michitaka and mother of Korechika and Teishi, empress to Emperor Ichijo. “Gidosanshi” (jundaijin）was Korechika’s official rank.

info.theme: 幸福の絶頂において死んでしまいたいという女心
info.meaning: いつまでも忘れはしないとおっしゃるあなたのお言葉が、将来いつまでも期待できるものとは思えませんから、今日を最後の命としたいと思います。
info.interpretation: You once said that you would never forget me, but as I have no way of knowing that your feelings will not change, I would like to end this life today.

author.name: 大納言公任
author.profile: 藤原公任 (966-1041) 父は頼忠。博学で歌人・歌学者。愛娘の死を哀しんで官を辞し、出家した。中古三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Dainagon Kinto
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Kinto (966-1041 C.E.)His father was Yoritada. A great poet and poet scholar, he quit his post as a bureaucrat and became a monk after the death of his beloved daughter. He was named as one of the Thirty-Six Medieval Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 水が涸れて久しい滝の今もなお伝わる名声への賛美
info.meaning: ここ大覚寺にあった滝の水の音が聞こえなくなってずいぶん長い年月が経てしまったが、その評判だけは世の中に流れ伝わり、今日でも聞こえ知られているよ。
info.interpretation: Many years have passed since the sound of the waterfall of Daikakuji Temple was last heard, and the rumor of its existence is now all that remains of it.

author.name: 和泉式部
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 小式部内侍の母。親王や公卿らとの恋を『和泉式部日記』に記す。中古三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Izumi Shikibu
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)She was the mother of Koshikibu-no-Naishi. She wrote of her love for a prince and a high-ranking government officer in the Izumi Shikibu Nikki (Diary of Izumi Shikibu). She was included amongst the Thirty-Six Medieval Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 来世への思い出にもう一度逢いたいという恋心
info.meaning: 私の命はもうすぐ尽きてしまうでしょう。せめて、あの世への大切な思い出として、私の命が尽きる前にもう一度だけ、あなたにお逢いしたいものです。
info.interpretation: I feel that my life is nearly to its end. In honor of the place I am going, I wish to see you just once more again before I go to that place.

author.name: 紫式部
author.profile: (970?-1016?) 藤原兼輔の曾孫で、大弐三位の母。結婚後数年で夫・藤原宣孝と死別し、一条天皇中宮彰子に出仕。『源氏物語』を著す。

interpretation.name: Murasaki-Shikibu
interpretation.profile: (c. 970-1016 C.E.) Great-granddaughter of Fujiwara-no-Kanesuke, she was the mother of Daini-no-Sanmi.After her husband Fujiwara-no-Nobutaka passed away,she served Shoshi ,empress to Emperor Ichijo.She is the author of"Genji Monogatari"(Tale of Genji)

info.theme: あわただしく帰っていった幼友だちへの名残惜しさ
info.meaning: 久しぶりにめぐり逢って見たのが確かであるかどうか、見分けがつかないうちにあなたは慌ただしく帰ってしまった。雲の間に隠れてしまった月のように。
info.interpretation: You were gone before I was able to see whether it was really you that I was seeing after all this time: you vanished like the moon behind the cloud.

author.name: 大弐三位
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 紫式部の娘。母に続いて中宮彰子に仕えた後、後冷泉天皇の乳母となった。

interpretation.name: Daini-no-Sanmi
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Daughter of Murasaki Shikibu. After serving Empress Shoshi as her mother did, she became wet nurse to Emperor Goreizei.

info.theme: 冷たい男に対して自分の変わらぬ気持を訴える心
info.meaning: 有馬山近くにある猪名の笹原に風が吹くとそよそよ鳴る音がする。そうですよ、（忘れるのはあなたの方であって）どうして私があなたのことを忘れることがありましょうか。
info.interpretation: A soft little rustling of the bamboo can be heard when the breeze sweeps through Ina near Mt. Arima, reminding me of you. Even if you forget me completely, I can never forget you.

author.name: 赤染衛門
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 藤原道長の妻・倫子に仕え、その娘・一条天皇中宮彰子にも仕えた。大江匡衡の妻となり、良妻賢母の誉れ高い。

interpretation.name: Akazome Emon
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Served Rinshi, wife of Fujiwara-no-Michinaga, as well as her daughter Shoshi, empress to Emperor Ichijo. Akazome Emon became the wife of Oe-no-Masahira, and was known as an excellent wife and mother.

info.theme: 来ると約束して来なかった男への恨み言
info.meaning: （あなたがおいでになる気配がなければ）ためらわずに寝てしまいましたものを。あなたをお待ちしていたばかりに西の空に沈んでいく月までも見てしまいました。
info.interpretation: As I was waiting in vain for you, I at last fall asleep alone, watching the moon set over the western sky.

author.name: 小式部内侍
author.profile: (?-1025) 和泉式部の娘。一条天皇中宮彰子に仕え、藤原教通らの寵愛を受けるが、二十代で早世。

interpretation.name: Koshikibu-no-Naishi
interpretation.profile: (?-1025 C.E.)Daughter of Izumi Shikibu. Served Shoshi, empress to Emperor Ichijo. Though a favorite of Fujiwara-no-Norimichi and others, she unfortunately died when she was still in her twenties.

info.theme: 母からの便りは受け取っていないという趣旨の伝達
info.meaning: 大江山を越えて行く生野の道のりが遠いので、まだ天の橋立へ行ったことはありませんし、ましてや母からの手紙なども見てはおりませんよ。
info.interpretation: The Ikuno road to Mt. Oeyama is so far away that I have not yet been to Amanohashidate, and my mother has sent me no letters.

author.name: 伊勢大輔
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 大中臣能宣の孫。一条天皇の中宮彰子に仕えた。晩年は白河天皇の養育係を務めた。

interpretation.name: Ise-no-Taifu
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)The grandchild of Onakatomi-no-Yoshinobu, she served Shoshi, empress to Emperor Ichijo. In her later years, she was placed in charge of rearing the Emperor Shirakawa.

info.theme: 旧都平城京の八重桜が、平安京の宮中に咲く美しさ
info.meaning: 昔、奈良の都で咲き誇っていた八重桜が、今日は平安京のこの宮中でいちだんと美しく咲き誇っていることであるよ。
info.interpretation: The double-blossoming cherry blossoms, once the pride of Nara, are now more beautiful than ever here in the court of Kyoto.

author.name: 清少納言
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 清原深養父の曾孫、元輔の娘。橘則光の妻となり一子を成すが離別。一条天皇の中宮定子に仕えて『枕草子』を著した。

interpretation.name: Sei Shonagon
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown) Great-grandchild of Kiyohara-no-Fukayabu, and daughter of Motosuke. She later married Tachibana-no-Norimitsu, but the two divorced despite the fact that they had one child between them. She served Teishi, empress to Emperor Ichijo, authoring Makura no Soshi.

info.theme: 夜深いうちに帰った男に対し、やり返す心
info.meaning: まだ夜も明けきらないうちに、鶏の鳴きまねをして、だまして通ろうとしても、私と逢うこの逢坂の関だけは決して通しはしませんから。
info.interpretation: You can try to fool me by crowing like a rooster before the dawn to get through unseen, but you will never get past Osaka, for I will surely see you there.

author.name: 左京大夫道雅
author.yomi: さきょうのだいぶみちまさ
author.profile: 藤原道雅 (992-1054) 内大臣伊周の子。幼時に家が没落、荒んだ半生を送ったが、晩年は歌会など風流を楽しむ。

interpretation.name: Sakyo-no-Daibu Michimasa
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Michimasa (992-1054 C.E.)A son of Naidaijin Korechika, he suffered hardship during the first half of his life due to the downfall of his family. In his later years, however, he was able to join in the high-society pursuit of poetry circles.

info.theme: あきらめると一言だけでも直接告げたい切なる思い
info.meaning: 今となってはただもうあなたのことはきっぱり思い切ってしまおう、というその一言だけを、他人に頼んでではなくて、直接あなたに言う方法があってほしいものだなあ。
info.interpretation: There is just one thing I wish to tell you in person, and not through someone else, and that is that everything is finished between us. I must find a way to tell you.

author.name: 権中納言定頼
author.yomi: ごんちゅうなごんさだより
author.profile: 藤原定頼 (995-1045) 藤原公任の子。父譲りで和歌に秀で、能書家でもあった。中古三十六歌仙の一人。

interpretation.name: Gonchunagon Sadayori
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Sadayori (995-1045 C.E.)Son of Fujiwara-no-Kinto, he inherited a gift for waka, and was also known as a great calligraphy master. He is included amongst the Thirty-Six Medieval Immortal Poets.

info.theme: 霧の絶え間に網代木が見える宇治川のすがすがしさ
info.meaning: 朝、だんだんと明るくなってくる頃、宇治川に立ち込めた川霧がとぎれとぎれに晴れていき、その霧の間から、しだいに現れてくるあちらこちらの川瀬に仕掛けた網代木よ。
info.interpretation: In the morning, as the morning light slowly dawns, the fog over the Uji River lifts little by little, and I see the wicker fishnets artfully drawn over the rapids.

author.name: 相模
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 源頼光の娘との説も。夫・大江公資の任地から相模と呼ばれた。離婚して脩子内親王に仕えた。

interpretation.name: Sagami
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Some believe that she may have been the daughter of Minamoto-no-Yorimitsu. She was known as Sagami from the name of the region to which her husband, Oe-no-Kinsuke, was appointed. She was divorced from her husband and went on to serve Princess Sushi.

info.theme: 恋の浮き名に朽ちてしまいそうな自分を惜しむ心
info.meaning: つれない人を恨み悲しんで流す涙で、乾くときもないこの袖さえ朽ちずに残っているのに、恋の噂で朽ちてしまう私の名が惜しいことですよ。
info.interpretation: My sleeves never dry from the constant tears I cry for that cold-hearted person, and yet these sleeves do not rot away. Yet it is hard for me to accept that my name is being tainted by the rumors of my love.

author.name: 前大僧正行尊
author.yomi: さきのだいそうじょうぎょうそん
author.profile: (1055-1135) 敦明親王の孫。園城寺で修行して諸国を遍歴した。加持祈祷で効験を現し、天皇の護持僧となり、後に天台座主となった。

interpretation.name: Saki-no-Daisojo Gyoson
interpretation.profile: (1055-1135 C.E.)He was a grandson of Prince Atsuakira. After training at Onjoji Temple, he wandered through many regions. He was a proponent of Buddhist blessings and prayers, becoming a monk in service of the emperor and later the head of the Tendai sect.

info.theme: 修行のために入った深山での山桜に呼びかける孤独感
info.meaning: 私がお前に親しみを感じるように、お前も一緒に私のことを懐かしく思っておくれ。山桜よ。お前以外に私の心を本当に知ってくれるものはいないのだから。
info.interpretation: I think of you as someone very close to me, and I hope you feel the same nostalgic way for me. Oh, mountain cherry blossoms, there is no one else in this world who knows me as you do.

author.name: 周防内侍
author.profile: 平安後期の女流歌人で生没年不詳。後冷泉、白河、堀河天皇らに仕えた。晩年、病にかかり出家した。

interpretation.name: Suo-no-Naishi
interpretation.profile: Though a well-known woman poet of the late Heian Period, little is known of her birth and death. She served Emperors Goreizei, Shirakawa, and Horikawa. In her later years she became a nun after falling ill.

info.theme: たわむれに契っては浮き名が立つと、断る気持ち
info.meaning: 春の夜の夢のようにはかないあなたの腕枕のために、つまらなく立ってしまう浮き名を残念に思うことです。
info.interpretation: I regret the loss of my name over reasons as small as the moment I spent with you lying next to me, a moment fleeting as a spring night.

author.name: 三条院
author.profile: (976-1017) 冷泉天皇の第二皇子。わずか五年で道長の圧迫により退位。出家してほどなく没した。

interpretation.name: Sanjo-in
interpretation.profile: (976-1017 C.E.)Second son of Emperor Reizei, he was ousted in just five years due to pressure from Michinaga. He died shortly after becoming a monk.

info.theme: 不遇な現実も恋しく思えるだろうという絶望的嘆き
info.meaning: 自分の本心に反して、この思うままにならないつらい世の中に生き永らえていたならば、その時はきっと恋しく思い出すに違いない。今夜のこの美しい月のことを。
info.interpretation: I have no choice but to go on living in this world of suffering, somehow lying to myself. In difficult times, I will remember tonight’s astonishingly beautiful moon.

author.name: 能因法師
author.profile: (988-?) 俗名は橘永愷。もと文章生だったが、二十六歳の頃に出家した。各地を旅し、歌を多く詠んだ。

interpretation.name: Noin Hoshi
interpretation.profile: (988-? C.E.)He was popularly known as Tachibana-no-Nagayasu. Originally a student of literature, he became a monk at around the age of 26. He traveled to many places and compiled a great number of songs.

info.theme: 竜田川に浮かぶもみじ葉の錦織のような美しさ
info.meaning: 激しい風によって吹き散らされた三室の山のもみじ葉は、やがて竜田の川に散り、ほら、水面を錦織の布のように鮮やかに彩っているよ。
info.interpretation: The maple tree leaves of Mt. Mimuro are scattered everywhere by the fierce gusts of wind, and now they cover the Tatsuta River like a gorgeous brocade of silk.

author.name: 良暹法師
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 詳しい伝記は不明。比叡山の僧で、祇園社の別当。洛北・大原に隠棲、晩年は雲林院に住んだという。

interpretation.name: Ryozen Hoshi
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Though there are no definitive records of his life, it is known that he was a monk at Mt. Hiei and also served as betto at Gionsha Shrine. He retired in Ohara, north of Kyoto, spending his later years at Unrin-in.

info.theme: ものみなが秋の夕暮れの寂寥をたたえている感慨
info.meaning: あまりの寂しさに、庵の外に出て辺りを物思いにふけりながら眺めてみると、私の心が悲しみに沈んでいるせいだろうか、どこもおなじように寂しい秋の夕暮れであるなあ。
info.interpretation: I’m so lonely that I venture out of my hermitage to take in the views, but perhaps because my despair is so great, everything else looks as forlorn as I do in this autumn hour of twilight.

author.name: 大納言経信
author.profile: 源経信 (1016-1097) 詩歌管弦に秀で、数々の歌合に出席し、判者も務める。任地・太宰府で没した。

interpretation.name: Dainagon Tsunenobu
interpretation.profile: Minamoto-no-Tsunenobu (1016-1097 C.E.)Adept at Chinese-style poems, waka, and gagaku orchestral music, he attended a number of poetry competitions, and also acted as a judge. He passed away at his post in Dazaifu.

info.theme: 夕方の田舎家に稲田を渡って吹いて来る秋風の風情
info.meaning: 夕方になると、家の前の田んぼに秋の風が訪れ、稲葉がさやさやとよい音を立てて揺れる。その冷たくて心地好い秋風は、私がいるこの葦葺きの田舎家にも吹き渡ってくるよ。
info.interpretation: When the sun goes down, the autumn breeze touches the fields in front of my home, enticing the rice stalks to whisper a lovely little song. The cool autumn night touches my heart too, as I sit in my country home of straw.

author.name: 祐子内親王家紀伊
author.yomi: ゆうしないしんのうけのき
author.profile: 平安後期の女流歌人で生没年不詳。祐子内親王（後朱雀天皇皇女）に仕えた。『堀河百首』の歌人の一人。

interpretation.name: Yushi Naishinnoke-no-Kii
interpretation.profile: Though she was a famed woman poet of the late Heian Period, her birth and death dates are unknown. She served Yushi Naishinno, a princess of the court of Emperor Gosuzaku. She is one of the poets mentioned in the Horikawa Hyakushu waka collection.

info.theme: 浮気で評判の男性に言い寄られ、それを拒む気持ち
info.meaning: うわさに名高い高師の浜の波は身にかけますまい。袖が濡れては大変ですから。おなじように浮気で名高いあなたのお言葉は心にかけますまい。袖を涙で濡らすのは嫌ですから。
info.interpretation: I refuse to get wet my kimono sleeves wet in the famed waves of Takashi-no-hama. In the same way, I cannot hear what you are saying, as you betray my trust in your dalliances, which are no secret. I do not wish my sleeves to be wet with tears.

author.name: 前中納言匡房
author.yomi: さきのちゅうなごんまさふさ
author.profile: 大江匡房 (1041-1111) 匡衡・赤染衛門の曾孫。博学で白河院に重用された。数多くの著書を残す。

interpretation.name: Gonchunagon Masafusa
interpretation.profile: Oe-no-Masafusa (1041-1111 C.E.)He was the great-grandchild of Masahira and Akazome Emon. He was held in high regard by Shirakawa-in on account of his great scholarship, producing numerous written works.

info.theme: はるかな山の峰に咲く桜への愛着
info.meaning: 遠くの高い山の頂きに山桜が美しく咲いたなあ。近いところの山の霞よ、どうか立たないでおくれ。あの美しい山桜が見えなくなってしまうから。
info.interpretation: Mountain cherry blossoms are blooming wildly on the faraway peaks. Mist of the nearby mountains, stay clear today so that we may behold the cherry blossoms in the distance.

author.name: 源俊頼朝臣
author.yomi: みなもとのとしよりあそん
author.profile: (1055?-1129?) 経信の子。もと堀河天皇近習の楽人。官位は高くないが、白河院の命で『金葉集』を撰す。

interpretation.name: Minamoto-no-Toshiyori-ason
interpretation.profile: (c. 1055-1129 C.E.)Son of Tsunenobu, he served as a musician in the court of Emperor Horikawa. Though he was not of high rank, he compiled the Kinyoshu waka collection on the command of Shirakawa-in.

info.theme: つれない人をなびかせようと祈ったが、叶わぬ嘆き
info.meaning: 私につれないあの人をなびかせてくれるようにと初瀬の観音様にお祈りはしたが、ああ、初瀬の山に吹く冷たい山おろしよ、お前のように冷たくなれとは祈らなかったのに。
info.interpretation: I prayed with all my heart to the Hatsuse Kannon that I could win you. I didn’t pray that you would become as cold as the winds billowing down from the hills of Hatsuse.

author.name: 藤原基俊
author.profile: (1060-1142) 右大臣俊家の子。博学だが官位には恵まれなかった。晩年、出家した。

interpretation.name: Fujiwara-no-Mototoshi
interpretation.profile: (1060-1142 C.E.)Son of Udaijin Toshiie. Though he was an accomplished scholar, his official rank remained low. He became a monk in his later years.

info.theme: 願っていた子供の栄達の約束が果たされぬ悲嘆
info.meaning: つらくても私を信じなさいというさしも草の歌に掛けた恵みの露のようにありがたい約束のお言葉を命綱のように頼ってきましたのに、今年の秋も過ぎてゆくようです。
info.interpretation: The promise you made to me was as beautiful as the due on the rush, and you implored me to have faith in you no matter how hard it was. Yet, alas, another autumn is going by and I have yet to cast eyes on you.

author.name: 法性寺入道前関白太政大臣
author.yomi: ほっしょうじにゅうどうさきのかんぱくだいじょうだいじん
author.profile: 藤原忠通 (1097-1164) 忠実の子。兼実と慈円の父。太政大臣に至る。父や弟と氏長者の地位を巡り争った。

interpretation.name: Hosshoji Nyudo Saki-no-Kanpaku Daijodaijin
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Tadamichi (1097-1164 C.E.)A son of Tadazane, he is also the father of Kanezane and Jien. He eventually rose to the post of Daijodaijin. He fought with his father and brother over the position of representative of the clan.

info.theme: 白雲と沖の白波とがとけあって見える大海原の眺め
info.meaning: 広々とした海に舟を漕ぎ出して、遥かかなたを見渡すと、沖の方には白い雲に見間違えるほどの大きな白波が立っていたのです。
info.interpretation: Out on the open sea in my boat, I looked to the gently curved horizon, and beheld a wave so massively white that I mistook it for clouds in the distance.

author.name: 崇徳院
author.profile: (1119-1164) 父は鳥羽天皇。父と不仲で退位させられる。保元の乱を起こし、配流先の讃岐で没した。

interpretation.name: Sutoku-in
interpretation.profile: (1119-1164 C.E.)His father was Emperor Toba, who forced him out of power after a dispute between them. He started the Hogen Uprising, and was subsequently exiled to Sanuki, where he died.

info.theme: 仲をさかれても将来は一緒になろうという強い恋心
info.meaning: 急な傾斜のため、川の瀬が激しく速いので、岩にせき止められた水の流れが一度は二筋に別れても、また後ほど出会うように、熱い思いで別れた私たちもまた必ず逢おうと思う。
info.interpretation: The rapids rush over a steep plummet, and the water is spliced into two currents by a rock in the center. Just like those two streams will meet once again, we two as well will have the chance to look upon each other in the future.

author.name: 源兼昌
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 父は俊輔。十二世紀初頭の歌人として知られる。

interpretation.name: Minamoto-no-Kanemasa
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Son of Toshisuke, he was a well-known poet in the early 12th century.

info.theme: 須磨の千鳥の声によってもよおされた旅の哀感
info.meaning: 海峡を隔てて日中は見えるあの淡路島から渡ってくる千鳥の鳴く悲しい声に、この須磨の関所の番人は幾夜目を覚まして物思いにふけったことだろうか。
info.interpretation: The sad cries of the plover can be heard as they make their way over the straits from Awaji Island, which can be seen during the day, yet is shrouded in darkness at night. I wonder how many times the night watchman at Suma has been awakened and tantalized by those cries.

author.name: 左京大夫顕輔
author.yomi: さきょうのだいぶあきすけ
author.profile: 藤原顕輔 (1090-1155) 父は藤原顕季。父に和歌を学んで、歌道の六条家を受け継いだ。『詞花集』の撰者。

interpretation.name: Sakyo-no-Daibu Akisuke
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Akisuke (1090-1155 C.E.)His father was Fujiwara-no-Akisue. Learning waka from his father, he succeeded the Rokujo waka lineage. He compiled the Shikashu, a collection of waka.

info.theme: 雲の間からもれて来る秋の月の光の清らかな美しさ
info.meaning: 秋風に吹かれて、大空に横に細くたなびいている雲の切れ間から、漏れて姿を現す月の光の、何という清らかな明るさであろう。
info.interpretation: The autumn wind blows and the moon peeks out from amongst the clouds in the great expanse of the sky. Its pure beauty and brightness pierce my heart.

author.name: 待賢門院堀河
author.yomi: たいけんもんいんのほりかわ
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 父は神祇伯源顕仲。待賢門院に仕えて堀河と呼ばれた。門院の出家に伴い自らも出家した。

interpretation.name: Taikenmon-in-no-Horikawa
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Her father was Jingihaku Minamoto-no-Akinaka. She became known as Horikawa during her service with Taikenmon-in. She became a nun when Taikenmon-in became a nun.

info.theme: 契りを結んだ翌朝の、心変わりを案じる恋の物思い
info.meaning: 末永く愛してくれると誓ったあなたの心が分からないので、一夜逢って別れた今朝の私の心はこの寝乱れた黒髪のように物思いで乱れていることですよ。
info.interpretation: I have no way of knowing your heart, you who promised to love me forever, and so I am lost in confusion like the tangles of my hair on this morning after you have taken leave of me.

author.name: 後徳大寺左大臣
author.yomi: ごとくだいじのさだいじん
author.profile: 藤原実定 (1139-1191) 右大臣公能の子で、定家の従兄弟。祖父の徳大寺左大臣と区別して後徳大寺左大臣と呼ばれた。晩年に病のため出家。

interpretation.name: Gotokudaiji-no-Sadaijin
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Sanesada (1139-1191 C.E.)A son of Udaijin Kinyoshi, and cousin to Teika. To differentiate him from his grandfather, Tokudaiji Sadaijin, he was known as Gotokudaiji Sadaijin. He became a monk in his later years after suffering an illness.

info.theme: ほととぎすの初音の方には月が浮かんでいたこと
info.meaning: 戸外の明け方近い夜空を、ひと声ほととぎすの鳴いた方角を見ると、もうその姿はなく、ただ夜明けの下弦の月だけが残っているのであった。
info.interpretation: The solitary song of a bird comes from somewhere in the night sky as dawn approaches, but looking in that direction I cannot find it, and only the moon is here to comfort me.

author.name: 道因法師
author.profile: (1090-?) 俗名を藤原敦頼。父は治部丞清孝。主に晩年、歌壇で活躍したといわれる。

interpretation.name: Doin Hoshi
interpretation.profile: (1090-? C.E.)He is popularity known as Fujiwara-no-Atsuyori. His father was Jibu-no-jo Kiyotaka. In his later years, he was active in waka circles.

info.theme: つれない人を恋慕うことのつらさ、悲しさ
info.meaning: 長い年月、つれない恋のため思い悩んでいても、こうして死にもせず命はあるのに、それでもそのつらさに耐えられなくて流れて仕方がないものは涙であることよ。
info.interpretation: For so long I have thought of my unrequited love, and though I remain alive it is too much for me to bear, and my life passes in day after melancholy day.

author.name: 皇太后宮大夫俊成
author.yomi: こうたいごうぐうのだいぶしゅんぜい
author.profile: 藤原俊成 (1114-1204) 藤原俊忠の息子で、定家の父。優れた歌人で、歌学者でもあった。後白河院の命により『千載集』を編纂。

interpretation.name: Kotaigogu-no-Daibu Shunzei
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Shunzei (1114-1204 C.E.)Son of Fujiwara-no-Toshitada and father to Teika. He was known as an excellent poet as well as poet scholar. On the order of Emperor Goshirakawa, he compiled the Senzaishu waka collection.

info.theme: 夜の苦しみ、つらさをはらうすべのない深いさびしさ
info.meaning: 世の中には悲しみやつらさから逃れられる道はないのだろうか。世間からずっと離れた山奥でさえ、鹿が妻恋しさに悲しげに鳴く声が聞こえてくる。
info.interpretation: I wonder if there is no way to be free of the despair and agony of this earth. Even in this mountain hermitage, far from the mundane world, the deer still cries longingly for his mate.

author.name: 藤原清輔朝臣
author.yomi: ふじわらのきよすけあそん
author.profile: (1104-1177) 顕輔の子。歌道の六条家を継いだ。『続詞花集』を編纂。

interpretation.name: Fujiwara-no-Kiyosuke-ason
interpretation.profile: (1104-1177 C.E.)A child of Akisuke, he perpetuated the Rokujo waka lineage. He also compiled the Shokushikashu.

info.theme: つらく苦しい現実に暗く沈みがちな心境
info.meaning: もしこの世に生き永らえていたら、つらい今が懐かしく思い出されることもあるのだろうか。かつてつらかったあのときも、今思い返すと恋しく懐かしく思われるのだから。
info.interpretation: If one lives to see old age, I wonder if one can look back on the hard times with the soft edge of nostalgia, just as I reminisce about past trials and tribulations today.

author.name: 俊恵法師
author.profile: (1113-?) 父は源俊頼。東大寺の僧で、平安末期の代表歌人として知られる。鴨長明は弟子。

interpretation.name: Shun-e Hoshi
interpretation.profile: (1113-? C.E.) Son of Minamoto-no-Toshiyori, he was a monk at Todaiji Temple. He is regarded as one of the great poets of the late Heian Period. Kamo-no-Chomei was a close student.

info.theme: 訪れて来ない男のつれなさを恨む心
info.meaning: 夜通し、まだ訪れぬお慕いするあの方のことを思い悩むときは、夜はなかなか明けないで、あの方を待つはずの寝間の戸のすきまさえ、私の気持ちを分かってはくれないものだ。
info.interpretation: The night passes ever so slowly as I think of the one I love, wishing she were here. Even the crack in the doorway where I wait for her to appear cannot express my intense longing.

author.name: 西行法師
author.profile: (1118-1190) 俗名は佐藤義清。もと武士だったが妻子を捨てて出家。諸国を旅して歌を多く詠んだ。

interpretation.name: Saigyo Hoshi
interpretation.profile: (1118-1190 C.E.)His common name was Sato Norikiyo. Once a samurai, he abandoned his secular life to become a monk. He traveled around Japan comprising a great number of poems.

info.theme: 恋の物思いで、月を見ても涙がこぼれ落ちる心境
info.meaning: 月が私を悲しませようとでもしているのか、いやそんなはずはないのだが、そうとでも思いたくなるほど、月にかこつけるようにして涙が流れてしまうのだ。
info.interpretation: I wonder if the moon is trying to make me feel sad. Oh, I know it is not so, yet my despair is so great that I want to place the blame on the moon. My tears flow in an endless stream.

author.name: 寂蓮法師
author.profile: (?-1202) 俗名は藤原定長。俊成の兄弟・阿闍梨俊海の息子。俊成の養子となるが、後に出家した。

interpretation.name: Jakuren Hoshi
interpretation.profile: (?-1202 C.E.)Popularly known by the name Fujiwara-no-Sadanaga, he was the son of Ajari Shunkai, brother of Shunzei. He was adopted by Shunzei, and later became a monk.

info.theme: 霧が立ちのぼる秋の夕暮れの、静かで心寂しい情景
info.meaning: にわか雨のしずくがまだ乾かずにとどまって輝いている針葉樹（杉や檜）の葉に、霧が谷間から涌き上がってくる秋の夕暮れの光景よ。
info.interpretation: Dazzling droplets of rain sit atop the leaves of the cedar tree, and the mist rises above the valley on a matchlessly beautiful fall evening.

author.name: 皇嘉門院別当
author.yomi: こうかもんいんのべっとう
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 父は源俊隆。皇嘉門院（崇徳院皇后聖子）に仕えた。

interpretation.name: Kokamon-in-no-Betto
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)She was the daughter of Minamoto-no-Toshitaka. Served Kokamon-in, empress to Sutoku-in, who was formerly known as Seishi.

info.theme: 旅寝の一夜の契りゆえの一途な女の恋心のあわれさ
info.meaning: 難波江の葦を刈ったあとの一節の根のように、短い仮寝の一夜だけのために、難波江の名物「みをつくし」でもあるまいに私は身を尽くして一生恋することになるのでしょうか。
info.interpretation: I will spend my life longing for the tiny glimpses of the love I felt on that fleeting night, short as the root of the reeds cut along the banks of Naniwa Bay.

author.name: 式子内親王
author.yomi: しょくし（しきし）ないしんのう
author.profile: (1149-1201) 後白河天皇の皇女。賀茂斎院を勤めた後、出家。藤原俊成、定家親子に和歌を学んだ。

interpretation.name: Shokushi Naishinno
interpretation.profile: (1149-1201 C.E.)A princess in the court of Emperor Goshirakawa, she became a nun after serving as Kamo-no-Saiin. She learned waka from father and son Fujiwara-no-Shunzei and Teika.

info.theme: 人目を忍び心に秘める、忍ぶ恋の激しい心情
info.meaning: 私の命よ、絶えるなら絶えてしまうがいいわ。このまま生き永らえたとしても、恋心を隠し通す気力も衰えてしまうことでしょうから。
info.interpretation: If my life must go on like this, it is better that it all ends now. Even if I go on living like this, I have no confidence that I can keep on hiding my feelings of love.

author.name: 殷富門院大輔
author.yomi: いんぶもんいんのたいふ
author.profile: (生没年不詳) 父は藤原信成。殷富門院（後白河院皇女亮子内親王）に仕え、門院の出家に従い出家した。

interpretation.name: Inpumon-in-no-Taifu
interpretation.profile: (Birth/death dates unknown)Daughter of Fujiwara-no-Nobunari. Served Inpumon-in (imperial princess of Emperor Goshirakawa, originally known as Ryoshi), becoming a nun when Inpumon-in became a nun.

info.theme: 相手のつれなさを嘆き、つらさを訴える恋の心情
info.meaning: ああ、あの人に見せたいものよ。雄島の漁師の袖でさえ、どれほど波しぶきで濡れに濡れたとしても色が変わらないというのに、私の袖はもう涙ですっかり色が変わっている。
info.interpretation: Oh how I want to show him. The sleeves of the fishermen’s garb are incessantly bombarded by the waves, but the color of the dye does not change. Yet I have cried so much that the hue of my sleeves pales to what it once was.

author.name: 後京極摂政前太政大臣
author.yomi: ごきょうごくせっしょうさきのだいじょうだいじん
author.profile: 藤原良経 (1169-1206) 父は関白九条兼実。藤原俊成に和歌を学び、歌合を主催するなど歌壇で活躍した。

interpretation.name: Gokyogoku-Sessho Saki-no-Daijodaijin
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Yoshitsune (1169-1206 C.E.)Hs father was Kanpaku Kujo Kanezane. He studied waka with Fujiwara-no-Shunzei, and was very active in waka circles including putting on poetry competitions.

info.theme: 寒い霜夜のひとり寝のわびしさ
info.meaning: こおろぎが鳴いている、霜の降りるそんな肌寒い夜、寒いばかりか私は、粗末なむしろの上に片袖を敷いて独りぼっちで寝るのだろうか。
info.interpretation: The crickets are singing and the mist is rising on this cool night. Am I to sleep alone on the sleeve of my kimono on this rough straw mat?

author.name: 二条院讃岐
author.yomi: にじょういんのさぬき
author.profile: (1141-1217) 父は源頼政。二条天皇や宜秋門院（後鳥羽天皇中宮）に仕えた後、出家した。

interpretation.name: Nijo-in-no-Sanuki
interpretation.profile: (1141-1217 C.E.)Her father was Minamoto-no-Yorimasa. She became a nun after serving Emperor Nijo and Gishumon-in (empress to Emperor Toba).

info.theme: 人知れぬ片恋の嘆き、悲しみ
info.meaning: 私の袖は、まるで潮が引いたときでさえ姿を現さない沖の石のように、いくらあの人が知らないなんて言ったって、涙で乾く間もないのですよ。
info.interpretation: My kimono sleeve is so wet with tears it is like the rock out in the ocean that does not even reveal itself when the tides are low. He may say that he knows nothing of me, but still my tears flow such that there is no time for them to dry.

author.name: 鎌倉右大臣
author.yomi: かまくらのうだいじん
author.profile: 源実朝 (1192-1219) 鎌倉幕府を築いた源頼朝の二男。三代将軍となるが、甥の公暁に暗殺された。

interpretation.name: Kamakura-no-Udaijin
interpretation.profile: Minamoto-no-Sanetomo (1192-1219 C.E.)Second son of Minamoto-no-Yoritomo, who established the Kamakura Shogunate, he was third shogun, but was assassinated by his nephew Kugyo.

info.theme: 漁師のさまを見て、世の無常を嘆く哀感
info.meaning: 変わりやすい世の中ではあるが、ずっと平和であってほしいことだ。この海辺は平穏で、渚を漕ぎ出す小舟が引き綱を引いている光景が、しみじみと愛しく心にしみることだ。
info.interpretation: I know that everything in this world is forever changing, and yet my wish is for lasting peace. The scene of this tranquil beach, dotted with fishermen casting their nets into the water, has become very dear to me.

author.name: 参議雅経
author.profile: 藤原雅経 (1170-1221) 父は頼経。和歌・蹴鞠の飛鳥井家を興した。『新古今集』の撰者の一人。

interpretation.name: Sangi Masatsune
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Masatsune (1170-1221 C.E.)Son of Yoritsune, he established the Asukai lineage of waka and the sport of kemari, and was also one of the compilers of the Shinkokinshu waka collection.

info.theme: きぬたの音が身にしみる、吉野山の秋の夜の寂しさ
info.meaning: 吉野の山から秋風が吹き、夜も更けた。昔、都だったこの里では寒さもいっそう身にしみて、砧（木や石の台）に置いた衣を打つ音が寒々と聞こえてくる。
info.interpretation: The autumn winds blow through Mt.Yoshino to hail the darkness. The coldness of this town, once the capital, chills one to the bone, and even the sound of someone striking cloth on a board makes me shiver.

author.name: 前大僧正慈円
author.yomi: さきのだいそうじょうじえん
author.profile: (1155-1225) 藤原忠通の子で、兼実の弟。十代前半で出家して比叡山に入山。天台座主を四度歴任した。歴史書『愚管抄』の著者。

interpretation.name: Saki-no-Daisojo Jien
interpretation.profile: (1155-1225 C.E.)Son of Fujiwara-no-Tadamichi and younger brother to Kanezane. He became a monk during his pre-teen years, training at Mt. Hiei. He was named head of the Tendai sect four times, and is the author of the historical volume Gukansho.

info.theme: 世の人々のために仏の加護を祈ろうとする決意
info.meaning: 身のほどをわきまえないことだが、このつらい世の中を生きる人々に覆い掛けるのだ。比叡山に住み、修行の道に入った私の僧衣の袖を。そして人々のために祈ろう。
info.interpretation: Suffering is part of life for all living things, and no one is free from it no matter who they are. Now I live and practice the way of Buddhism at Mt. Hiei. I wish to protect all beings with the sleeve of my monk’s robe, and I pray for their happiness.

author.name: 入道前太政大臣
author.yomi: にゅうどうさきのだいじょうだいじん
author.profile: 藤原公経 (1171-1244) 内大臣実宗の子で、西園寺家を興す。太政大臣になった後、出家した。

interpretation.name: Nyudo Saki-no-Daijodaijin
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Kintsune (1171-1244 C.E.)A child of Naidaijin Sanemune, he was responsible for establishing the Saionji family. He went on to become a monk after serving as Daijodaijin.

info.theme: 桜の落花に寄せて述べる自身の老いの嘆き
info.meaning: 桜を誘って散らす激しい風が吹く庭。そこに散り敷くのは雪かと思う。しかしふる（降る）のは雪ではなく、実は古びていく私自身なのだ。
info.interpretation: The wind blows through the garden, scattering the cherry blossoms, and there are so many petals that one could mistake them for snow. Yet it is not snow that is falling; rather it is I who is fading.

author.name: 権中納言定家
author.yomi: ごんちゅうなごんさだいえ
author.profile: 藤原定家 (1162-1241) 俊成の子。平安末期・鎌倉初期の代表的歌人。『新古今集』の撰に加わり、『小倉百人一首』を編纂した。

interpretation.name: Gonchunagon Teika
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Teika (1162-1241 C.E.)Son of Shunzei, he is considered one of the great poets of the late Heian Period and early Kamakura Period. He was also involved in the compilation of the Shinkokinshu waka collection, and he is responsible for the Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets).

info.theme: 待てども来ぬ人を待つ女心のもどかしさ、嘆き
info.meaning: 待っても来ない人を待つ私は、松帆の浦の浜辺で焼いている藻塩の煙がなびいているが、この身も恋の思いにこがれていく、そんな気持ちなのだ。
info.interpretation: Waiting endlessly for my beloved, my heart burns with loneliness like the fires of the seaweed roasted along the banks of Matsuho-no-ura, the columns of smoke reaching ever upward.

author.name: 従二位家隆
author.profile: 藤原家隆 (1158-1237) 父は光隆。藤原俊成に和歌を学び、定家らとともに『新古今集』を撰した。

interpretation.name: Junni Ietaka
interpretation.profile: Fujiwara-no-Ietaka (1158-1237)He was the son of Mitsutaka. Learning waka from Fujiwara-no-Shunzei, he compiled the Shinkokinshu waka collection together with Teika and others.

info.theme: 秋の気配が感じられる、夏の終わりの夕暮れの情感
info.meaning: 楢の葉を揺らすそよ風が吹き、夕暮れは秋のように涼しい。しかし、上賀茂神社の境内を流れる御手洗川で行われるみそぎの光景を見ると、やはりまだ夏なのだなあ。
info.interpretation: The breeze gently plays with the oak leaves, making the nights cool as autumn. Still, when I see the pilgrims purifying themselves in the stream flowing from the Kamigamo Shrine, I realize that summer has not yet left us.

author.name: 後鳥羽院
author.profile: (1180-1239) 高倉天皇の皇子。承久の乱で鎌倉幕府打倒を図るが失敗。配流地・隠岐で没した。

interpretation.name: Gotoba-in
interpretation.profile: (1180-1239)Son of Emperor Takakura. He attempted to topple the Kamakura Shogunate with the Jokyu Uprising, but failed. He died in exile on Oki Island.

info.theme: 愛憎が交錯し、思い悩みつつ世に生きる身の嘆き
info.meaning: ある時は人々を愛しく思い、またある時は恨めしいとも思う。この世はどうにかならないものだろうが、それゆえに物思いをする私であるよ。
info.interpretation: Sometimes I feel others are very dear to me, while at other times I can only reproach them. I know there is no way to make things go as I wish, and yet I am lost in the reverie of my desires.

author.name: 順徳院
author.profile: (1197-1242) 後鳥羽天皇の皇子。藤原定家に和歌を学ぶ。承久の乱で敗れ、配流地の佐渡で没した。

interpretation.name: Juntoku-in
interpretation.profile: (1197-1242 C.E.)Son of Emperor Gotoba, he studied waka with Fujiwara-no-Teika. Losing in the Jokyu Uprising, he died in exile on Sado Island.

info.theme: 栄えていた昔の御代を懐かしみ朝廷の衰微を嘆く心
info.meaning: 宮中よ、時代を経て古びてしまった建物の軒の端に、しのぶ草が生い茂っている。それを見るにつけ、朝廷が栄えた昔のよき時代がしのばれて懐かしく思われることだ。
info.interpretation: The grasses grow under the eaves of this old building of the imperial grounds, and the sight makes me nostalgic for the days of glory of the court.
